frameDefinitions: In this frame an Agent continues to possess a Theme for a Duration of time. ''
An Entity is understood to be experienceable within a particular set of delimited Circumstances, which may be more narrowly expressed by a Time, Place.
A Cognizer applies oneself to commit a Pattern to memory, so that the Cognizer would recognize future examples of the Pattern or be able to reproduce it.
This frame is concerned with Cognizers remembering and forgetting mental Content.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.
frameExamples: In her heart she must <t>retain</t> bitterness against those who had killed him.
This type of behavior <t>occurs</t> in several primate mating rituals.
A gaggle of students were frantically <t>memorizing</t> the answers out in the hall.
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
The police <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The entity which the <fen>Agent</fen> possesses for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Theme</fen>.
An object or event that is described as being available under delimited Conditions.
A temporal characterization of the circumstances of the existence of an <fen>Entity</fen>.
A spacial characterization of the <fex name=''>Circumstances</fex> of the existence of the <fex name=''>Entity</fex>.
A description of the state of the world in which the <fen>Entity</fen> can be experienced.
The sentient being that focuses on a <fen>Pattern</fen> so that it will remain in the memory.
The phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> observes and commits to memory.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> memorizes the <fen>Pattern</fen>.
The location wherein the <fen>Cognizer</fen> memorizes the <fen>Pattern</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose mental <fen>Content</fen> is at issue.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the mental content that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> retains or forgets.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject the <fen>Cognizer</fen> mental <fen>Content</fen> is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the remembering or forgetting of mental <fen>Content</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the remembering or forgetting takes place.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
<fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
<fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.
listRoleExamples: At all times <fex>the Saxon government</fex> held on to its insistently practiced political tradition.
Once you've got a War Bond, hang on to <fex>it</fex> for the full ten years of its life.
Margerite held on to the key <fex>on Wednesday</fex> until I returned to pick it up.
He will retain <fex>in his heart</fex> the memory of the vast Holocaust.
<fex>I</fex> have memorized two kinds of knowledge from Allah's Apostle
Impress your friends by memorizing <fex>your phone numbers</fex> and throwing away your PDA!
Barney memorized the poem <fex>yesterday</fex>.
Herbert Kornfeldt memorized his speech <fex>in the mailroom</fex>.
Each student must be able to recall <fex>the whole paragraph</fex>  .
John forgot everything <fex>about his uncle</fex>.
She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
The police arrested Harry <fex>on charges of manslaughter</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested <fex>Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.
They arrested Harry <fex>for shoplifting</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
